    • Method Detail

      • getSingleton

        public static HyPeerWeb getSingleton()

      • addToHyPeerWeb

        public void addToHyPeerWeb(Node newNode,
                  Node startNode)
        Adds a new node to the HyPeerWeb.
        Parameters:
        newNode - The node to add to the HyPeerWeb.
        startNode - The node that represents the start point in the HyPeerWeb.
        Pre-condition:
        newNode is not null/NULL_NODE; startNode is not null and is in nodes
        Post-condition:
        newNode is in nodes and is connected to the HyPeerWeb

      • removeFromHyPeerWeb

        public void removeFromHyPeerWeb(Node removeNode)
        Removes a node from the HyPeerWeb
        Parameters:
        removeNode - The node to remove from the HyPeerWeb.
        Pre-condition:
        removeNode is not null/NULL_NODE and is in nodes;
        Post-condition:
        removeNode has been removed from HyPeerWeb. Web has N-1 nodes and connections are updated.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(Node node)

      • clear

        public void clear()

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Node node)

      • getHyPeerWebDatabase

        public HyPeerWebDatabase getHyPeerWebDatabase()

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(int webId)
        Returns the node of the provided webId.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId of the Node you want to get.
        Pre-condition:
        0 <= webId < size()
        Post-condition:
        result = Node with given webId

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reloads the HyPeerWeb from the database using the default database name.
        Pre-condition:
        None
        Post-condition:
        All nodes are removed from the HyPeerWeb and the nodes in the existing default database are loaded into the HyPeerWeb

      • reload

        public void reload(java.lang.String dbName)
        Rebuilds the HyPeerWeb from the database provided. If the dbName is null then the results are loaded from the default database.
        Parameters:
        dbName - The name of the database you want to load from
        Pre-condition:
        None
        Post-condition:
        All nodes are removed from the HyPeerWeb and the nodes in the provided database are loaded into the HyPeerWeb along with their connections and pointers.

      • removeNode

        public void removeNode(Node node)
        Removes a node from the HyPeerWeb. Note: This does not remove it from the database...You have to call saveToDatabase afterwards for permanent changes.
        Parameters:
        node - The node being removed from the HyPeerWeb

      • saveToDatabase

        public void saveToDatabase()
        Clears the database, then adds all of the current nodes (including references) back into the database.

      • size

        public int size()
        Determines the size of this HyPeerWeb Segment
        Returns:
        The number of nodes in this segment

      • close

        public void close()
        This method is being called from the GUI.
